text:
I would absolutely love to see HubSpot support much more HubL from the available field types in the module.css

Anyone else here love the same thing?

This would be nice for just keeping things separate — but I also don’t think that there is really a functional difference between including your CSS in module.css vs in a `require_css`  block in module.html
<@UQWGKUEN7> using `require_css` in the `module.html` includes the CSS in a `<style>` block in the `<head>` and also doesn't auto minify which would be a very nice to have.

Ahh yes I forget about the Minification part — I would imagine that inlined css should perform better in smaller chunks (modules) - even unminified, as there arent any extra calls to fetch styesheets. But I haven’t tested.

Either way — not shooting down this idea — I think it would def be a nice to have.

I don't know if it's just me, I was actively trying to find a way to make `require_js` work in the JS section, it annoys me to have to include JS in the head just because I can't find a way to queue dependencies

For example, I can't wait for a carousel script to load before my JS tries to run a carousel.

I have to either include the command to run in the vendor file of the carousel script or call it from the HTML
<@U02RW89P7TQ> yes! Having the ability to use `{{ hubl }}` conditionals in the module.js would be awesome as well.
